meanings.definition: A disappointing end to an exciting or impressive series of events.
meanings.sent1: The movie's ending was an anticlimax, leaving the audience feeling let down.
meanings.sent2: The final scene of the play was an anticlimax after the intense build-up.
meanings.sent3: The highly anticipated concert turned out to be an anticlimax when the main singer lost their voice.
meanings.sent4: The championship game ended in an anticlimax, with the star player missing the winning shot.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display concluded in an anticlimax, with only a few sparks in the sky.

meanings.definition: A sudden transition in discourse from an important idea to a trivial one.
meanings.sent1: The professor's lecture had an anticlimax when he abruptly switched from discussing quantum physics to talking about his favorite ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech started with powerful statements but ended in an anticlimax as he began discussing his pet cat.
meanings.sent3: The debate took an unexpected anticlimax when the serious topic of climate change shifted to a debate on the best pizza toppings.
meanings.sent4: The novel's climax was followed by an anticlimax as the author introduced a random subplot about gardening.
meanings.sent5: The meeting had an anticlimax when the CEO's speech about company growth suddenly turned into a discussion about office snacks.

meanings.definition: A letdown or a decrease in intensity or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The party's anticlimax came when the DJ suddenly stopped the music and announced it was time to go home.
meanings.sent2: The game's anticlimax occurred when the star player got injured and had to leave the field.
meanings.sent3: The concert's anticlimax was when the band played their hit song first and had nothing left to build up to.
meanings.sent4: The book's anticlimax left readers feeling unsatisfied after the thrilling chapters that came before.
meanings.sent5: The vacation's anticlimax was the rainy weather that persisted throughout the trip, dampening everyone's spirits.
